titlestmt.titleproper: J. Roderick O'Flanagan diary and manuscript 1842-1853
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: J. Roderick O'Flanagan diary and manuscript

bioghist.p: James Roderick O'Flanagan (1814-1900) wrote extensively on Irish government and law. His books include Lives of the Lord Chancellors and Keepers of the Great Seal of Ireland and Annals, Anecdotes, Traits, and Traditions of the Irish Parliaments, 1172 to 1800.

scopecontent.p: This volume contains a manuscript of The Law Relating to the Offices and Duties of Sheriffs in Ireland with Tables of Fees, Practical Forms and Precedents by James Roderick O'Flanagan, Esq. Barrister at Law. The other half of the volume contains O'Flanagan's diary (1853). The diary entries appear to document O'Flanagan's home and work life.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
